title: Graphics Programming
description: A project focused on developing a 3D scene using OpenGL and C++, where I explored rendering techniques and post-processing effects.
points: Gained in-depth knowledge of graphics rendering with buffers, and the functionality of Framebuffers and PostFX.
Enhanced proficiency in C++ programming.

Successfully implemented features including cube rendering, terrain generation from a heightmap, a custom water shader, post-processing effects such as chromatic aberration and bloom, and object loading using the Assimp library.

title: DrRon's Showdowns
description: A 2D boss-fight game inspired by Cuphead and Terraria, where I contributed as the lead artist and UI designer.
points: Developed an innovative game concept that could potentially fill a niche in the market.
Took on the role of the primary artist for the team, providing a refreshing shift from programming responsibilities.
Deepened expertise in Adobe Animate, focusing on animating menu screens and designing the user interface.

title: Tune Tap Studio
description: A solo project where I created a custom Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) in Unity, focusing on intuitive UI and efficient data handling.
points: Learned how to design intuitive and visually comprehensible user interfaces.
Implemented efficient saving, loading, and exporting processes using binary and JSON formats.
Developed the tool using a single MonoBehaviour with a clean, well-structured codebase.

title: Designing A Boss Battle
description: A solo project focused on designing a complex boss battle using NodeCanvas, a behavior tree tool, while enhancing my artistic and animation abilities.
points: Acquired a solid understanding of behavior trees and their application in game development.
Gained hands-on experience with the NodeCanvas package for behavior tree implementation.
Explored and refined artistic and animation skills during the design process.

title: Coding a Behaviour Tree
description: A project focused on coding a custom behavior tree system, strengthening my understanding of AI programming and pixel art.
points: Built a custom behavior tree using composite, decorator, and action nodes, strengthening problem-solving abilities in AI development.
Expanded knowledge of Unity's 2D AI navigation mesh (NavMesh) system.
Continued to refine pixel art skills, integrating them into game design.

title: Planet Destroyer
description: A project focused on code architecture and design patterns, emphasizing clean, maintainable code and system integration.
points: Applied various design patterns to create a clean and maintainable codebase.
Implemented custom event systems alongside observer, object pool, and factory patterns.
Gained experience in creating UML diagrams to model system architecture.

title: Deadline Droids
description: A project focused on creating a game to introduce prospective students to our study program, with an emphasis on multiplayer gameplay and networking.
points: Gained experience in developing multiplayer functionality in Unity.
Utilized Unity's Netcode for GameObjects package to create a local multiplayer prototype.
Designed an educational game for new students, effectively presenting the study program through an engaging concept.
